title: Serum Otoconin-90 and Otolin-1 Levels in Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo
content: Objective: To evaluate the value of otolith‑associated protein otoconin‑90 (OC90) and otolin-1 in the pathogenesis research and clinical treatment of benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). Material and Method: The study included 50 patients with BPPV admitted to neurology and otorhinolaryngology departments and 30 healthy subjects with no history of dizziness as control group. Results: BPPV and controls were similar in terms of gender and age. Otolin-1 level was significantly greater in the BPPV group than controls (710.44 [584.35-837.39] vs 280.45 [212.7-419.61] ; p
